  • Method Details

    • getLine

      public static java.lang.String getLine()
      This method gets a line from from the command line asynchronously.
      Returns:
      the String in input.

    • getInt

      public static java.lang.Integer getInt​(java.lang.String errorMessage)
      This method gets an integer from from the command line asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - Message in case of Not-a-Number.
      Returns:
      the Integer in input.

    • getBoolean

      public static java.lang.Boolean getBoolean()
      This method gets a boolean from from the command line asynchronously.
      Returns:
      the boolean in input.

    • getWorkerChoice

      public static java.lang.String getWorkerChoice​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> possibleWorkers)
      This method makes the player choose the worker that will be used in his next action given the possible workers (the ones who can move/build).
      Parameters:
      possibleWorkers - is the list of workers' ids that re possible to choose.
      Returns:
      the chosen worker's id.

    • getActionChoice

      public static java.lang.Integer getActionChoice​(boolean makeChoiceForbidden, boolean restartForbidden, boolean confirmActionForbidden)
      This method makes the player choose three different behaviours during his action: - 1 if the player wants to make a choice. - 2 if the player wants to restart the entire action. - 3 if the player wants to confirm his current decisions.
      Parameters:
      makeChoiceForbidden - is true if the choice is forbidden (there are no possible ones). false otherwise.
      restartForbidden - is true if restart is forbidden (the player can't restart because there are no past actions to redo), false otherwise.
      confirmActionForbidden - is true if the player cannot confirm his current actions (there are no current actions), false otherwise.
      Returns:
      an Integer corresponding to the chosen behaviour.

    • getPoint

      public static java.awt.Point getPoint​(int x, char y)
      This method returns a Point given the coordinates used in the GraphicalBoard to display the board' positions to the user.
      Parameters:
      x - is the coordinate X that goes from 1 to #columns.
      y - is the coordinate Y that goes from A to the (#rows)th letter of the alphabet.
      Returns:
      a Point containing the coordinates of the translated position on the board.

    • getPoint

      public static java.awt.Point getPoint​(java.lang.String point)
      This method returns a Point given the coordinates used in the GraphicalBoard to display the board' positions to the user.
      Parameters:
      point - is a String containing the coordinates used to display positions in the GraphicalBoard (ex. A1, B3,...).
      Returns:
      a Point containing the coordinates of the translated position on the board.

    • getCoordinates

      public static java.lang.String getCoordinates​(java.awt.Point position)
      This method returns the coordinates used to display positions on the GraphicalBoard given the real positions' coordinates in the board.
      Parameters:
      position - is a Point containing the coordinate X that goes from 0...columns and the coordinate Y that goes from 0...rows.
      Returns:
      a String containing the coordinates used to display positions in the GraphicalBoard (ex. A1, B3,...).

    • getChosenPosition

      public static java.awt.Point getChosenPosition​(java.util.List<java.awt.Point> availablePositions, java.lang.String worker)
      This method makes the player choose his next move given the available positions.
      Parameters:
      availablePositions - is the List of possible choices.
      worker - is the worker's id used during the move.
      Returns:
      a Point containing the chosen coordinates, null if there are problem with connections during the choice.

    • getChosenBuildingsInPoint

      public static boolean getChosenBuildingsInPoint​(java.util.Map<java.awt.Point,​java.util.List<BuildingType>> possibleBuildingsInPositions, java.lang.String worker, java.util.List<java.awt.Point> currentDataOrder, java.util.Map<java.awt.Point,​java.util.List<BuildingType>> currentBuilds)
      This method makes the player choose his next building action given the possible buildings and their position on the board.
      Parameters:
      possibleBuildingsInPositions - is the map that associates positions to the possible buildings.
      worker - is the worker's id used during the build.
      currentDataOrder - is the current order of positions where the player built.
      currentBuilds - is a map that associates the positions to the buildings built during the action.
      Returns:
      true if the choice is performed, false otherwise (errors due to disconnections).

    • getInitialPositions

      public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.awt.Point> getInitialPositions()
      This method makes the player choose his initial workers' positions.
      Returns:
      a Map that associates workers' ids to their new position on the board.

    • fromBuildingTypeToInt

      public static int fromBuildingTypeToInt​(BuildingType buildingType)
      This method maps BuildingType to the corresponding number. (ex. DOME for 4)
      Parameters:
      buildingType - is the BuildingType enum to map.
      Returns:
      an integer associated with the given enum.

    • fromIntToBuildingType

      public static BuildingType fromIntToBuildingType​(int level)
      This method maps an integer to the corresponding BuildingType. (ex. 2 for SECOND_FLOOR)
      Parameters:
      level - is the integer enum to map.
      Returns:
      a BuildingType enum associated with the given integer.
